name: Pelletized Rawmat
description: Small spherical pellets of high-purity materials, coated in a thin layer of non-reactive polymer to prevent clumping and contamination. Used as printer feedstock and in many industrial processes.
author: system

name: Bulk Organic Printfeed
description: Edible (if unpalatable) organic material replete with vitamins, minerals, and other nutrients. Typically comprised of algaes grown in orbital farms, these substances are used as feedstock for household or shipboard culinary printers.
author: system

name: Electronic Components
description: A variety of electronic components, including processors, memory modules, sensors, and other high-tech devices. All components are sensitive to static discharge and must be transported in specialized intermodal containers.
author: system

name: Culinary Printers
description: GMS Type-31b Household Culinary Printers, used to create food from bulk organic printfeed. While unable to reproduce the full range of flavors and textures of traditionally prepared foods, their output is vastly better than printloaf, and as such they are popular for their convenience and versatility.
author: system

name: Synthetic Spidersilk
description: Bales of high-strength fiber with a tensile strength comparable to steel, but with much lower density. Used in a variety of applications, including construction, textiles, and medical devices.
author: system

name: Ground Vehicles
description: All-terrain transport vehicles, designed to be easily disassembled and reassembled, and are shipped in modular containers to facilitate rapid deployment and assembly upon arrival.
author: system

name: Industrial Solvents
description: A variety of industrial solvents, used for cleaning, degreasing, and other industrial processes. All are toxic to some degree, and must be handled with care.
author: system

name: Industrial Nanites
description: A variety of nanoscale machines used in industrial processes, including construction, repair, and manufacturing. All are highly sensitive to environmental conditions, and must be transported in specialized containment vessels to prevent inadvertent replication.
author: system

name: Diasporan Tourists
description: A group of tourists from the Diaspora, visiting the system for a short time.
author: system

name: Core Emigrants
description: A group of emigrants from a Core system, seeking a new life in the Rim. They are traveling in cryostasis to obviate the effects of the long journey.
author: system

name: Dyson Strut
description: A massive component used in the construction of astroengineering projects, such as collector swarms, photon shrouds, transfer arrays, and similar extremely-large-scale structures. The strut is designed to be able to withstand the intense gravitational forces and radiation present in the vicinity of a star.
author: system

name: Anchor Casing
description: A containment vessel for a Blink Gate's anchor, an extremely durable shell designed to contain the apparatus that maintain the gate's seed rupture. These massive structures are built within exacting tolerances to ensure the stability and reliability of the gate network, and so must be transported with care to prevent damage to the delicate internal components.
author: system
